content.question:
Compound
<math alttext="delta H solution, in kilojoules per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>H</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>mol</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="N a F, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaF</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
<math alttext="positive 0.91" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo> </mo><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>0.91</mn></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="M g F 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MgF</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
<math alttext="negative 18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mpadded></math>

Based on the information in the table above, the solubility of which compound, if any, will increase if the water temperature is increased?

choices.label: <math alttext="N a F, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaF</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> only
<math alttext="M g F 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MgF</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> only

Both <math alttext="N a F, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaF</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="M g F 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MgF</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

The solubility of neither <math alttext="N a F, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaF</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> nor <math alttext="M g F 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>MgF</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> will increase.

content.answer: <math alttext="N a F, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaF</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> only

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
